intro: Rubus flos-amygdali, commonly known as the almond raspberries, is a species of shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its prickly stems and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red to black berries that are typically consumed fresh or used in jams and preserves. Botanically, it has pinnate leaves with three to five leaflets and is often found in woodland areas. Its fruit is notable for its tart flavor and high antioxidant content.
